startNewFragment

protected void startNewFragment(java.lang.Class fragmentClass,
                                java.lang.Class fragmentActivityClass,
                                java.lang.String key,
                                java.io.Serializable arbitraryValue)
Starts a new fragment in the appropriate place. If the screen has one pane (as with a mobile phone), an intent is created with the given FragmentActivity. Else, if the screen has two panes (such as with a large tablet), the given Fragment is started in the detail pane. Some fragments require some extra information. This is usually one key/value pair. You may provide the String key and an arbitrary Serializable value. If this behavior is not required, pass in null for the key. One may also use the two-argument method of the same name instead.

Parameters:
fragmentClass - The Fragment that needs to be created in the detail pane.
fragmentActivityClass - The FragmentActivity that should be spawned if there is no detail pane.
key - The key attached either to the FragmentTransaction or the Activity spawning Intent. Set this to null if not needed.
arbitraryValue - The Serializable value attached.
